result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael K Tate

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael K Tate appeared by phone.  Attorney Patrick Thomas Earle in court for Michael K Tate.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for deferred prosecution agreement hearing.
CASE HEARD IN BRANCH 37 FOR BRANCH 30.
For reasons set forth in the record, defense requested adjournment of proceedings. Court grants request.  
Case remains calendared in Branch 30. 
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing on October 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Michael K Tate appeared by video.  Attorney Patrick Thomas Earle appeared by video for Michael K Tate.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for deferred prosecution agreement hearing.
Defendant has TAD evaluation scheduled for 9/12/2022 and defense counsel requests additional time.
DPA Hearing adjourned to Branch 30.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Michael K Tate in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Earle.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael K Tate appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for status conference. State informs Defense this case is being considered for DPA. Defense requests an adjournment to review with client. Case adjourned to Br 30.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael K Tate in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael K Tate appeared by video means.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Matter scheduled for Pretrial Conference.  Defendant appears in Court without counsel.  Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation. Defendant requests court appointed counsel at the county rate. Court appoints Attorney Pat Earle who shall be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour. Court orders defendant to repay the County at a rate of $50.00/month beginning upon completion of the case and every month thereafter until paid in full.  Case adjourned for status conference in Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Michael K Tate in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/27/2022@1pm
